meanings.sent1: I can discriminate between the colors red and blue.
meanings.sent2: It is important to discriminate between right and wrong.
meanings.sent3: The robot learned to discriminate between shapes for its task.
meanings.sent4: Her keen eyes could discriminate even the subtlest differences in the paintings.
meanings.sent5: The ability to discriminate between truth and lies is crucial.

meanings.sent1: It is wrong to discriminate against someone based on their appearance.
meanings.sent2: The company policy strictly prohibits any form of discrimination.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to discriminate against the new food by refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: She felt discriminated against when her ideas were constantly overlooked.
meanings.sent5: Discriminating against others only leads to division and unhappiness.

meanings.definition: Make a clear distinction in favor of or against a person or thing
meanings.sent1: The judge had to discriminate between the two conflicting testimonies.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to discriminate between genuine and fake products.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to discriminate in favor of the squeaky toy over the plush one.
meanings.sent4: She had to discriminate between her loyalty to her friend and her sense of justice.
meanings.sent5: His biased actions clearly discriminate in favor of his own interests.
